thing-type.label: FGS224 Fibaro Double Smart Module
thing-type.description: Fibaro Double Smart Module<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<h1&gtDescription</h1&gt <p&gtThe remotely operated FIBARO Smart Module and Double Smart Module are designed to turn electrical devices or circuits on and off. Smart Module allows to control one device or circuit and the Double Smart Module allows to control two devices or circuits. The compact size of the device allows for the product to be installed in the housings of other devices. The devices can be controlled either via the Z-Wave™ network or with buttons connected directly to them.</p&gt <h1&gtMain features</h1&gt <ul&gt<li&gtWorks with various types of switches and buttons.</li&gt <li&gtSupports Z-Wave network Security Modes: S0 with AES-128 encryption and S2 Authenticated with PRNG-based encryption.</li&gt <li&gtWorks as a Z-Wave signal repeater</li&gt <li&gtMay be used with all devices certified with the Z-Wave Plus™ certificate and should be compatible with such devices produced by other manufacturers.</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtTo add the device to the Z-Wave network manually:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtQuickly, three times click button connected to S1/S2 or the maintenance button.</li&gt <li&gtLED will start blinking yellow, wait for the adding process to end.</li&gt <li&gtAdding result will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and the LED: <ul&gt<li&gtGreen – successful (non-secure, S0, S2 non-authenticated),</li&gt <li&gtMagenta – successful (Security S2 Authenticated),</li&gt <li&gtRed – not successful. </li&gt </ul&gt</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNote:</strong&gt Removing also results in resetting the device to factory defaults. Make sure that restoring the parameters to factory defaults will not result in damaging the connected device, we recommend disconnecting it first.</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtQuickly, three times click the maintenance button.</li&gt <li&gtLED will start blinking yellow, wait for the removing process to end.</li&gt <li&gtSuccessful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and red LED colour.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtQuickly, three times click the maintenance button.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Remember relays state
parameter.description: This parameter determines the state of relays after power supply failure.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines the state of relays after power supply failure (e.g. power outage).</p&gt <p&gtFor auto OFF and flashing modes the parameter is not relevant and the relay will always remain switched off.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: state of relays after restoring power
Restore state after restoring power see overview

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: S1 input – switch type
parameter.description: type of switch connected to the S1<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines as what type the device should treat the switch connected to the S1 terminal. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: S2 input – switch type
parameter.description: type of switch connected to the S2<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines as what type the device should treat the switch connected to the S2 terminal. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_24_1
parameter.label: 24: Inputs orientation
parameter.description: reversing operation of S1 and S2 inputs<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows reversing operation of S1 and S2 inputs without changing the wiring. Use in case of incorrect wiring</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_25_1
parameter.label: 25: Outputs orientation
parameter.description: reversing operation of Q1 and Q2 outputs<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows reversing operation of Q1 and Q2 outputs without changing the wiring. Use in case of incorrect wiring. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_30_4_000000FF
parameter.label: 30: Alarm configuration 1 Action Type
parameter.description: which alarm frames and how the device should react<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt <p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gtDefault Value [0x05, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00] (Water Alarm, any notification, no action)</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action: 0x00 – no action, 0x01 – turn ON, 0x02 – turn OFF, 0x03 – turn ON/OFF continuously</p&gt </td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_30_4_0000FF00
parameter.label: 30: Alarm configuration 1 Event/State
parameter.description: Event/State Parameters

parameter.name: config_30_4_00FF0000
parameter.label: 30: Alarm configuration - 1st slot - Notify Status
parameter.description: Notification Status

parameter.name: config_30_4_7F000000
parameter.label: 30: Alarm configuration - 1st slot - Notify Type
parameter.description: Notification Type

parameter.name: config_31_4_000000FF
parameter.label: 31: Alarm configuration - 2nd slot
parameter.description: Water Alarm<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gtDefault Value [0x05, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00] (Water Alarm, any notification, no action)</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action: 0x00 – no action, 0x01 – turn ON, 0x02 – turn OFF, 0x03 – turn ON/OFF continuously</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.label: 31: Alarm configuration - 2nd slot

parameter.label: 32: Alarm configuration - 3rd slot - Smoke Alarm
parameter.description: Action<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action: 0x00 – no action, 0x01 – turn ON, 0x02 – turn OFF, 0x03 – turn ON/OFF continuously</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.description: Notification Type

parameter.name: config_33_4_000000FF
parameter.label: 33: Alarm configuration - 4th slot - CO Alarm
parameter.description: Action<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action: 0x00 – no action, 0x01 – turn ON, 0x02 – turn OFF, 0x03 – turn ON/OFF continuously</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.label: 33: Alarm configuration - 4th slot - CO Alarm
parameter.description: Notification Type

parameter.name: config_34_4_000000FF
parameter.label: 34: Alarm configuration - 5th slot
parameter.description: Heat Alarm<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action: 0x00 – no action, 0x01 – turn ON, 0x02 – turn OFF, 0x03 – turn ON/OFF continuously</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_35_2
parameter.label: 35: Alarm configuration – duration
parameter.description: duration of alarm sequence<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines duration of alarm sequence. When time set in this parameter elapses, alarm is cancelled and relays restore normal operation, but do not recover state from before the alarm. </p&gt <p&gt0 – infinite 1-32400 (1s-9h, 1s step) – duration</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 600 (10min)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: S1 input – scenes sent
parameter.description: actions result in sending scene IDs<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent). Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learning mode by triple clicking.</p&gt <p&gt15 (all active) Available values</p&gt <p&gt0 – no scenes sent</p&gt <p&gt1 – Key pressed 1 time</p&gt <p&gt2 – Key pressed 2 times</p&gt <p&gt4 – Key pressed 3 times</p&gt <p&gt8 – Key hold down and key released</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Key hold down and key released

parameter.name: config_41_1
parameter.label: 41: S2 input – scenes sent
parameter.description: actions result in sending scene IDs<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent). Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learning mode by triple clicking.</p&gt <p&gt0 – no scenes sent</p&gt <p&gt1 – Key pressed 1 time</p&gt <p&gt2 – Key pressed 2 times</p&gt <p&gt4 – Key pressed 3 times</p&gt <p&gt8 – Key hold down and key released</p&gt <p&gt15 - all active</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Key hold down and key released

parameter.name: config_150_1
parameter.label: 150: First channel – operating mode
parameter.description: choose operating mode for channel Q/Q1 output<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to choose operating mode for channel controlled with Q/Q1 output. For timed modes (value 1, 2 or 3), time is set with parameter 154 and reaction to input change is set with parameter 152. </p&gt <p&gt0 – standard operation</p&gt <p&gt1 – delayed OFF</p&gt <p&gt2 – auto OFF</p&gt <p&gt3 – flashing</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_151_1
parameter.label: 151: Second channel – operating mode
parameter.description: operating mode for channel Q2 output<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to choose operating mode for channel controlled with Q2 output. For timed modes (value 1, 2 or 3), time is set with parameter 155 and reaction to input change is set with parameter 153.</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 0 (standard operation)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values</p&gt <p&gt0 – standard operation</p&gt <p&gt1 – delayed OFF</p&gt <p&gt2 – auto OFF</p&gt <p&gt3 – flashing</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_152_1
parameter.label: 152: 1.Ch. reaction in delayed/auto OFF modes
parameter.description: S1 input in timed modes<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt<strong&gtFirst channel – reaction to input change in delayed/ auto OFF modes</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter determines how the device reacts when changing state of S1 input in timed modes for first channel.</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 0 (cancel mode)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values</p&gt <p&gt0 – cancel mode and set default state</p&gt <p&gt1 – no reaction, mode runs until it ends</p&gt <p&gt2 – reset timer, start counting time from the beginning</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: cancel mode and set default state
no reaction, mode runs until it ends

parameter.name: config_153_1
parameter.label: 153: 2.Ch. reaction in delayed/auto OFF modes
parameter.description: S2 input in timed modes<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt<strong&gtSecond channel – reaction to input change in delayed/ auto OFF modes</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter determines how the device reacts when changing state of S1 input in timed modes for first channel.</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 0 (cancel mode)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values</p&gt <p&gt0 – cancel mode and set default state</p&gt <p&gt1 – no reaction, mode runs until it ends</p&gt <p&gt2 – reset timer, start counting time from the beginning</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: cancel mode and set default state
no reaction, mode runs until it ends

parameter.name: config_154_2
parameter.label: 154: 1.Ch. time parameter
parameter.description: timer for first channel.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt<strong&gtFirst channel – time parameter for delayed/auto OFF and flashing modes</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes for first channel. For delayed/auto OFF modes it determines duration, for flashing mode it determines cycle period.</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 5 (0.5s)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values</p&gt <p&gt0 – 0.1 seconds 1-32000 – 0.1-3200 seconds, 0.1s step</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_155_2
parameter.label: 155: 2.Ch. time parameter
parameter.description: timer for second channel<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt<strong&gtSecond channel – time parameter for delayed/auto OFF and flashing modes</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gthis parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes for first channel. For delayed/auto OFF modes it determines duration, for flashing mode it determines cycle period.</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 5 (0.5s)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values</p&gt <p&gt0 – 0.1 seconds 1-32000 – 0.1-3200 seconds, 0.1s step</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_156_2
parameter.label: 156: S1– Switch ON value to 2. association group
parameter.description: command to devices in 2nd association group<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt<strong&gtS1 input – Switch ON value sent to 2nd association group</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter defines value sent with Switch ON command to devices in 2nd association group when using S1 input.</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 255</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values</p&gt <p&gt0 – turn off</p&gt <p&gt1-99 – turn on and set level</p&gt <p&gt255 – turn on with last level</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_157_2
parameter.label: 157: S1– Switch OFF value to 2. association group
parameter.description: command to devices in 2nd association group<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt<strong&gtS1 input – Switch OFF value sent to 2nd association group </strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter defines value sent with Switch OFF command to devices in 2nd association group when using S1 input.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 0</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values</p&gt <p&gt0 – turn off</p&gt <p&gt1-99 – turn on and set level</p&gt <p&gt255 – turn on with last level</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_158_2
parameter.label: 158: S1 - Double click to 21nd association group
parameter.description: Value send to 2nd ass.group<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtS1 input – Double Click value sent to 2nd association group</p&gt <p&gt This parameter defines value sent with Double Click command to devices in 2nd association group when using S1 input.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 99</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values</p&gt <p&gt0 – turn off</p&gt <p&gt1-99 – turn on and set level</p&gt <p&gt255 – turn on with last level</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_159_2
parameter.label: 159: S2–Switch ON value to 3rd association group
parameter.description: value to 3rd association group<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtS2 input – Switch ON value sent to 3rd association group</p&gt <p&gtOnly in Double Smart Module</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter defines value sent with Switch ON command to devices in 3rd association group when using S2 input.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 255</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values</p&gt <p&gt0 – turn off</p&gt <p&gt1-99 – turn on and set level</p&gt <p&gt255 – turn on with last level</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_160_2
parameter.label: 160: S2-Switch ON value to 3rd association group
parameter.description: value to 3rd association group<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtS2 input – Switch ON value sent to 3rd association group</p&gt <p&gtOnly in Double Smart Module</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter defines value sent with Switch ON command to devices in 3rd association group when using S2 input.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 255</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values</p&gt <p&gt0 – turn off</p&gt <p&gt1-99 – turn on and set level</p&gt <p&gt255 – turn on with last level</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_161_2
parameter.label: 161: S2–Double Click value to 3rd association group
parameter.description: value to 3rd association group<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt<strong&gtS2 input – Double Click value sent to 3rd association group</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtOnly in Double Smart Module</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter defines value sent with Double Click command to devices in 3rd association group when using S2 input.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 255</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values</p&gt <p&gt0 – turn off</p&gt <p&gt1-99 – turn on and set level</p&gt <p&gt255 – turn on with last level</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_162_1
parameter.label: 162: Q/Q1 output type
parameter.description: This parameter determines type of Q1 output.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtQ/Q1 output type Description</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter determines type of Q/Q1 output. Parameter size 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 0 (Normally Open)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values</p&gt <p&gt0 – Normally Open (relay contacts opened turned off, closed when turned on)</p&gt <p&gt1 – Normally Closed (relay contacts closed turned off, opened when turned on)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_163_1
parameter.label: 163: Q2 output type
parameter.description: parameter determines type of Q2 output<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtQ2 output type</p&gt <p&gtOnly in Double Smart Module</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter determines type of Q2 output.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 0 (Normally Open)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values</p&gt <p&gt0 – Normally Open (relay contacts opened turned off, closed when turned on)</p&gt <p&gt1 – Normally Closed (relay contacts closed turned off, opened when turned on)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_164_1
parameter.label: 164: Lock Q1 and Q2 outputs
parameter.description: Lock Q1 and Q2 outputs<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtLock simultaneous switching of Q1 and Q2 outputs</p&gt <p&gtOnly in Double Smart Module</p&gt <p&gtWhen the lock is enabled, both outputs cannot be turned on at the same time.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 0 (lock disabled)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values</p&gt <p&gt0 – lock disabled</p&gt <p&gt1 – lock enabled</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_0
parameter.label: 0: Lifeline
parameter.description: reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt1st association group – “Lifeline” reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: On/Off (1)
parameter.description: is used to turn the associated devices on/off reflecting input operation for 1st channel (uses Basic command class).<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt2nd association group – “On/Off (1)” is used to turn the associated devices on/off reflecting input operation for 1st channel (uses Basic command class).</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: On/Off (2)
parameter.description: is used to turn the associated devices on/off reflecting input operation for 2nd channel (uses Basic command class).<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt3rd association group – “On/Off (2)” is used to turn the associated devices on/off reflecting input operation for 2nd channel (uses Basic command class).</p&gt
